==Events==
* [[109]] &ndash; Roman emperor [[Trajan]] inaugurates the [[Aqua Traiana]], an [[Roman aqueduct|aqueduct]] that channels water from [[Lake Bracciano]], {{convert|40|km|mi|abbr=off}} north-west of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]].
* [[474]] &ndash; [[Julius Nepos]] forces Roman usurper [[Glycerius]] to abdicate the [[throne]] and proclaims himself Emperor of the [[Western Roman Empire]].
* [[637]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Moira]] is fought between the [[High King of Ireland]] and the Kings of [[Ulster]] and [[Dalriada]]. It is claimed to be the largest battle in the history of [[Ireland]].
* [[972]] &ndash; [[Battle of Cedynia]], the first documented victory of [[Poland|Polish]] forces, takes place.
*[[1128]] &ndash; [[Battle of São Mamede]], near [[Guimarães]]: forces led by [[Alfonso I of Portugal|Alfonso I]] defeat forces led by his mother [[Theresa, Countess of Portugal|Teresa of León]] and her lover [[Fernando Pérez de Traba]]. After this battle, the future king calls himself "Prince of Portugal", the first step towards "official independence" that will be reached in [[1139]] after the [[Battle of Ourique]].
*[[1230]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Jaén (1230)|Siege of Jaén]] started in the context of the Spanish Reconquista.
*[[1314]] &ndash; [[First War of Scottish Independence]]: the [[Battle of Bannockburn]] concludes with a decisive victory by [[Scottish people|Scottish]] forces led by [[Robert the Bruce]], though [[Kingdom of England|England]] did not recognize [[Kingdom of Scotland|Scottish]] independence until [[1328]] with the signing of the [[Treaty of Edinburgh-Northampton]].
*[[1340]] &ndash; [[Hundred Years' War]]: [[Battle of Sluys]] &ndash; The [[France|French]] fleet is almost completely destroyed by the English Fleet commanded in person by King [[Edward III of England|Edward III]].
*[[1374]] &ndash; A sudden outbreak of [[Dancing mania|St. John's Dance]] causes people in the streets of [[Aachen]], [[Germany]], to experience [[hallucination]]s and begin to jump and twitch uncontrollably until they collapse from exhaustion.
*[[1497]] &ndash; [[John Cabot]] lands in [[North America]] at [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]] leading the first European exploration of the region since the [[Vikings]].
*[[1509]] &ndash; [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] and [[Catherine of Aragon]] are crowned King and Queen of England.
*[[1535]] &ndash; The [[Anabaptist]] state of [[Münster Rebellion|Münster]] is conquered and disbanded.
*[[1571]] &ndash; [[Miguel Lopez de Legazpi]] founds [[Manila]], the capital of the [[Republic of the Philippines]].
*[[1597]] &ndash; The first [[Netherlands|Dutch]] voyage to the [[East Indies]] reaches [[Bantam (city)|Bantam]] (on [[Java (island)|Java]]).
*[[1604]] &ndash; [[Samuel de Champlain]] discovers the mouth of the [[Saint John River (New Brunswick)|Saint John River]], site of [[Reversing Falls]] and the present day city of [[Saint John, New Brunswick]], [[Canada]].
*[[1622]] &ndash; [[Battle of Macau]]: The Dutch attempt but fail to capture [[Macau]].
*[[1717]] &ndash; The [[Premier Grand Lodge of England]], the first [[Freemasonry|Masonic]] Grand Lodge in the world (now the [[United Grand Lodge of England]]), is founded in [[London]], [[England]].
*[[1779]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: The [[Great Siege of Gibraltar]] begins.
*[[1793]] &ndash; The [[French Constitution of 1793|first Republican constitution]] in [[France]] is adopted.
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon's]] [[La Grande Armée|Grande Armée]] crosses the [[Neman River]] beginning the [[Napoleon's Invasion of Russia|invasion]] of [[Russia]].
*[[1813]] &ndash; [[Battle of Beaver Dams]]: a [[United Kingdom|British]] and Indian combined force defeats the [[United States Army]].
*[[1821]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Carabobo]] takes place. It is the decisive battle in the war of independence of [[Venezuela]] from [[Spain]].
*[[1859]] &ndash; [[Battle of Solferino]] (Battle of the Three Sovereigns): [[Sardinia]] and France defeat [[Austria]] in [[Solferino]], northern [[Italy]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[Battle of Custoza (1866)|Battle of Custoza]]: an [[Austrian Empire|Austrian]] army defeats the [[Italy|Italian]] army during the [[Austro-Prussian War]].
*[[1880]] &ndash; First performance of ''[[O Canada]]'', the song that would become the [[national anthem]] of [[Canada]], at the Congrès national des Canadiens-Français.
*[[1894]] &ndash; [[Marie Francois Sadi Carnot]] is assassinated by [[Sante Geronimo Caserio]].
*[[1902]] &ndash; King [[Edward VII of the United Kingdom]] develops [[appendicitis]], delaying his coronation.
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Greece]] and [[Serbia]] annul their alliance with [[Bulgaria]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Mary Pickford]] becomes the first female film star to sign a million dollar [[contract]].
*  1916   &ndash; [[World War I]]: the [[Battle of the Somme]] begins with a week-long artillery bombardment on the [[Germany|German Line]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; First [[airmail]] service in [[Canada]] from [[Montreal]] to [[Toronto]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; A bloodless [[Siamese Revolution of 1932|Revolution]] instigated by the [[Khana Ratsadon|People's Party]] ends the absolute power of King [[Prajadhipok]] of [[Rattanakosin Kingdom|Siam]] (now [[Thailand]]).
*[[1938]] &ndash; Pieces of a [[meteor]], estimated to have weighed 450 [[metric ton]]s when it hit the Earth's atmosphere and exploded, land near [[Chicora, Pennsylvania]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; Siam is renamed [[Thailand]] by [[Plaek Pibulsonggram]], the country's third [[prime minister]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[Kenneth Arnold]] makes the first widely reported [[Kenneth Arnold Unidentified Flying Object Sighting|UFO sighting]] near [[Mount Rainier]], [[Washington (state)|Washington]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; Start of the [[Berlin Blockade]]: the [[Soviet Union]] makes overland travel between [[West Germany]] and [[West Berlin]] impossible.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The first [[Westerns on television|television western]], ''[[Hopalong Cassidy]]'', is aired on [[NBC]] starring [[William Boyd (actor)|William Boyd]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[First Indochina War]]: [[Battle of Mang Yang Pass]] — [[Vietminh]] troops belonging to the 803rd Regiment ambush G.M. 100 of [[France]] in [[An Khê]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; In ''[[Roth v. United States]]'', the [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] rules that obscenity is not protected by the [[First Amendment to the United States Constitution|First Amendment]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; The United Kingdom grants [[Zanzibar]] internal self-government.
*[[1981]] &ndash; The [[Humber Bridge]] is opens to traffic, connecting [[Yorkshire]] and [[Lincolnshire]]. It would be the world's longest single-span suspension bridge for 17 years.
*[[1982]] &ndash; "The Jakarta Incident": [[British Airways Flight 9]] flies into a cloud of volcanic ash thrown up by the eruption of [[Mount Galunggung]], resulting in the failure of all four engines.<!--Resulted in world record, book, awards, etc. -->
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Jiang Zemin]] succeeds [[Zhao Ziyang]] to become the [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of China]] after [[1989 Tiananmen Square Protests]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; "[[1995 Rugby World Cup|Rugby World Cup final]]": South Africa defeats New Zealand, Nelson Mandela presents Francois Pienaar with the Webb-Ellis trophy in an iconic post-apartheid moment.
*[[2004]] &ndash; In New York, [[capital punishment]] is declared unconstitutional.
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[John Isner]] of the [[United States]] defeats [[Nicolas Mahut]] of [[France]] at [[The Championships, Wimbledon|Wimbledon]], in [[Isner–Mahut match at the 2010 Wimbledon Championships|the longest match in professional tennis history]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Lonesome George]], the last known individual of [[Chelonoidis nigra abingdonii]], a subspecies of the [[Galápagos tortoise]], dies.
